posts.title: Github Copilot Injection to RCE
posts.excerpt: The folks at Trail of Bits have an interesting post on how they tricked Github Copilot into installing a backdoor which allows remote code execution. Lovely! https://blog.trailofbits.com/2025/08/06/prompt-injection-engineering-for-attackers-exploiting-github-copilot/

posts.title: GPT-OSS Jailbroken
posts.excerpt: Looks like Chat GPT’s open source model has already been jailbroken. Shipping models with safety cards doesn’t make them safe, but it does make it fun for hackers to bypass. https://x.com/_lyraaaa_/status/1952825311118475607?s=46&t=gbXFVtdeAqulPOfK2uLh7g

posts.title: Cursor MCP to RCE
posts.excerpt: Looks like there is a new CVE out there against Cursor that allows attackers to run arbitrary code once you accept a file into your local repo. Bad vibes, man! https://research.checkpoint.com/2025/cursor-vulnerability-mcpoison/

posts.title: Perplexity Hiding IPs and User Agents
posts.excerpt: Cloudflare announced that the caught Perplexity lying about its user agent and changing IP space to violate website owner choice to prevent them from crawling websites. And these people are in charge of deciding the ethics of their LLMs. https://x.com/cloudflare/status/1952362105253847100?s=46&t=gbXFVtdeAqulPOfK2uLh7g
posts.filename: Perplexity Hiding IPs and User Agents.md

posts.title: AI age Discrimination
posts.excerpt: In Mobley v. Workday, job applicant over 40 who says he was rejected over 80 times by companies using Workday’s AI tools. He claims their algorithm systematically filtered out older applicants. https://x.com/thejobchick/status/1952365445388067046?s=46&t=gbXFVtdeAqulPOfK2uLh7g

posts.title: AI Used In Vogue Ad Sparks Backlash
posts.excerpt: The fashion industry is increasingly adopting artificial intelligence to create models and advertisements, due to cost-saving and efficiency. The recent use of an AI-generated model in Vogue's advertising has created backlash from fashion professionals concerned about job security and authenticity. There goes a lot of fashion jobs. https://techcrunch.com/?p=3033447
posts.filename: AI Used In Vogue Ad Sparks Backlash.md

posts.title: AI-powered IDE vulnerable to prompt-injection attacks
posts.excerpt: A critical vulnerability known as CurXecute affects the AI-powered Cursor integrated development environment (IDE), allowing attackers to execute remote code with developer privileges through prompt-injection attacks. This security flaw, identified as CVE-2025-54135, poses risks for data theft and ransomware. Attackers could potentially exploit the vulnerability without user interaction, leading to severe consequences for software projects. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/ai-powered-cursor-ide-vulnerable-to-prompt-injection-attacks/
posts.filename: AI-powered IDE vulnerable to prompt-injection attacks.md

posts.title: DataComp CommonPool PII
posts.excerpt: A significant amount of personally identifiable information (PII) has been discovered in the DataComp CommonPool data set, which is widely used for training image generation models. This includes images of sensitive documents and data from individuals. The dataset contains hundreds of millions of potentially identifiable images due to extensive web scraping practices. So if your information gets leaked it could be used to train the next big AI model. https://www.technologyreview.com/2025/07/18/1120466/a-major-ai-training-data-set-contains-millions-of-examples-of-personal-data/

posts.title: AILLM limitations in content moderation pose risks
posts.excerpt: A recent study by Microsoft has assessed various occupations for their applicability to artificial intelligence, identifying which roles may be at risk of automation and which are expected to remain stable. The findings suggest that jobs heavily reliant on knowledge work are more susceptible to AI replacement, while blue-collar roles are less likely to be affected. https://gizmodo.com/?p=2000637340
posts.filename: AILLM limitations in content moderation pose risks.md

posts.title: Artificial Intelligence Trojan Horse for Childrens Cognitive Development
posts.excerpt: Recent developments in artificial intelligence, particularly tools designed for interaction with users, may have implications for cognitive development in children. Concerns are being raised about the impact of reliance on these technologies on mental engagement, motivation, and overall cognitive health, potentially leading to adverse effects such as diminished learning and increased risk of cognitive decline. The observation that even those involved in technology are limiting their children's exposure suggests a growing awareness of these risks. AI tools like Grok’s Ani are designed to engage users deeply, potentially fostering dependency and excessive use of AI can lead to reduced brain activity and cognitive decline. https://www.zerohedge.com/ai/ai-tool-or-trojan-horse-why-im-deeply-concerned-minds-our-children
posts.filename: Artificial Intelligence Trojan Horse for Childrens Cognitive Development.md
